page_content:
Graph - Graph Creation

Version:MissionOS_2.0

Graphs are the most common representation of various MissionOS elements and instruments in the field at different user locations.

You can create and edit graphs to visualise your instruments, in the Graph creation page.

Perform the following steps to access this page:

  1. Log into the MissionOS portal.
  2. Click open the Data Manager.

 

 

 

In Data Manager, navigate to Admin > Data Object Configuration > Object Definition, and then click the Graph tab.

 

 

To list Graphs:

After you select the Graph tab, to list the graphs associated with an object subtype, perform the following steps:

  1. Select Class Type.
  2. Select Class.
  3. Select Object Type.
  4. Select Object SubType.
    The corresponding graph details get listed in the table.

Note:

  • Edit the graph details using the Edit icon, if required.
  • Delete the graph details using the Delete icon.
  • Search for graphs using the Search field.


To create Graphs:

To create graphs, perform the following steps:

  1. Once you are in the Graph interface, select the required Class Type, Class, Object Type and Object SubType.
  2. Click Add New.
    The graph creation fields appear.
  3. Enter the Graph Name and the Graph Title.
  4. Select the Date Pre-sets from the time range options.
  5. Select Instrument end date, if required. 

    Note:

    Instrument End Date -   Select the option so that the graph can plot from the start date (as per date option) to the end date of instrument data available in portal.

    For example,

    Instrument A has its latest data on June 5th 2021 in portal. 

    If we enable the checkbox and select the date option as ‘last 1 month’, then graph is plotted with the data between May 5th to June 5th 2021.

    Otherwise, the graph is plotted with the data from last 1 month from today. (end date is considered as current date)



  6. Select Graph Type from the dropdown. (Based on this selection, dropdown options in the Plot Type changes.)
  7. Select Group. (Ranges from 1 Hr to 1 Month)
  8. Select Method.
  9. You can select or unselect available review checks based on your requirements.
  10. Select the option to add axis text if required.
  11. Select Latest Data Point from the dropdown after selecting the checkbox. (Refer to the note for details) 

    Note:

    Latest Data Point – has 3 sub options:

    Select the following based on requirements:

    • Latest Data Point - If we select this, you can view latest data point value on the top of the graph plot
    • Latest Timestamp – here you can view latest date time on the top of the graph plot
    • Both – Select this option to view latest data point as well as timestamp on top


  12. Enter the following data in the X-axis:
    1. Select Parameter from the dropdown. Based on the selection of Parameter, new fields appear.
    2. Select the Timestamp.
    3. Type the Caption.
    4. Select the Range as Auto or Defined.
    5. Select the Unit to Display.
    6. Type the Gridline Units.
    7. Select the Data Order as Ascending or Descending. (Refer to figure 3)

  13. Enter the data in the Y-axis, similar to X-axis. The following are the additional fields in the Y-axis:
    1. Select Parameter from the dropdown. Based on the selection of Parameter, new fields appear.
    2. Type the Caption.
    3. Select the Data Type.
    4. Select the Range as Auto or Defined.
    5. Type the Gridline Units.
    6. Select the Unit to Display.
    7. Select the Data Order as Ascending or Descending. (Refer to figure 4)

  14. Click Save Graph.
    You can select Set as Default Graph before you save the information, if required.
    If graph is set as the default graph, in other page setups of the same object type, this graph appears as the default one.

 

 

 

 

 

Refer to figure 5 to view the graph creation:
